meanings.definition: A type of ancient Greek water jar with three handles.
meanings.sent1: In the museum, I saw a beautiful hydriae on display.
meanings.sent2: The archaeologists discovered many hydriae during the excavation.
meanings.sent3: The hydriae at the market seemed to gossip with each other about the other pottery.
meanings.sent4: Her collection of hydriae was like a trio of ancient guardians in her home.
meanings.sent5: The hydriae gleamed in the sunlight, their handles reaching out like welcoming arms.

meanings.definition: Plural form of hydria, referring to multiple ancient Greek water jars with three handles.
meanings.sent1: The hydriae in the museum were all unique in design.
meanings.sent2: During the festival, the villagers used hydriae to carry water for the celebration.
meanings.sent3: The hydriae lined up on the shelf looked like a trio of friends chatting.
meanings.sent4: The hydriae in the garden stood tall like ancient sentinels guarding the plants.
meanings.sent5: As the sun set, the shadows of the hydriae elongated across the courtyard, creating a mystical atmosphere.
